intro: Cubeba lowong, commonly known as wild cubeba, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Piperaceae and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that contain aromatic seeds used in traditional medicine. Its leaves are often used in herbal remedies due to their purported anti-inflammatory and antimicrobial properties. Cubeba lowong thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests.
